title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
description: A romantic novel about Elizabeth Bennet and her dealings with issues of manners, upbringing, morality, education, and marriage in the society of the landed gentry of early 19th-century England.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: A novel about the serious issues of rape and racial inequality told through the eyes of a young girl in the American South during the 1930s.

author: George Orwell
description: A dystopian social science fiction novel about a society under totalitarian rule where independent thinking is a crime.

title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: A novel about the American dream and the excesses of the Jazz Age, following the mysterious millionaire Jay Gatsby and his obsession with Daisy Buchanan.

title: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
author: J.K. Rowling
description: The first novel in the Harry Potter series, about a young wizard who discovers his magical heritage on his eleventh birthday.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
description: A coming-of-age story following teenager Holden Caulfield as he experiences alienation and rebellion in 1950s New York.

title: Lord of the Flies
author: William Golding
description: A novel about a group of British boys stranded on an uninhabited island and their disastrous attempt to govern themselves.

title: The Handmaid's Tale
author: Margaret Atwood
description: A dystopian novel set in a near-future New England where a totalitarian state subjects fertile women to child-bearing slavery.

title: Beloved
author: Toni Morrison
description: A novel about the legacy of slavery and its psychological impact, following a former slave haunted by the ghost of her deceased daughter.

title: One Hundred Years of Solitude
author: Gabriel García Márquez
description: A landmark work of magical realism chronicling seven generations of the Buendía family in the fictional town of Macondo.

title: The Kite Runner
author: Khaled Hosseini
description: A story of friendship, guilt, and redemption set against the backdrop of Afghanistan's tumultuous history.

title: Life of Pi
author: Yann Martel
description: A philosophical novel about a young Indian boy stranded on a lifeboat in the Pacific Ocean with a Bengal tiger.

title: The Book Thief
author: Markus Zusak
description: Set in Nazi Germany, this novel tells the story of a young girl living with foster parents who steals books and shares them with others.

title: The Alchemist
author: Paulo Coelho
description: A philosophical novel about a young Andalusian shepherd's journey to the Egyptian pyramids in pursuit of his personal legend.

title: Gone Girl
author: Gillian Flynn
description: A psychological thriller about the disappearance of a woman and the subsequent media frenzy surrounding her husband.

title: The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo
author: Stieg Larsson
description: A crime thriller about a journalist and a computer hacker investigating a wealthy family's dark secrets.

title: The Help
author: Kathryn Stockett
description: Set in 1960s Mississippi, this novel explores the lives of African American maids working in white households during the civil rights movement.

title: Where the Crawdads Sing
author: Delia Owens
description: A coming-of-age mystery novel about a young woman who grew up isolated in the marshlands of North Carolina.

title: Educated
author: Tara Westover
description: A memoir about a woman who grows up in a survivalist family in rural Idaho and eventually earns a PhD from Cambridge University.

title: Becoming
author: Michelle Obama
description: A memoir by the former First Lady of the United States, chronicling her life from childhood through her years in the White House.
